metadata.synopsis: Dark Urge wakes up to the corpse of Alfira in camp.If companions are around, you will have some explaining to do.NOTE: Always put Astarion in group slot 2  if there are multiple companions
metadata.how_to_trigger: Queue Camp Night NIGHT_DarkUrge_MurderOfAlfiraEnd the DayGo to Bed

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Another waif dead before her time. I wonder how it happened.
2.context: NodeContext: [Astarion:waking up with the rest of the party to find a dead body in camp, Less sad, more worried that someone could get so close while everyone slept.]

153.speaker: Player
153.text: You summoned us. You must know something
153.context: InternalNodeContext: Remove REALLY_SHADOWHEART tag check if the subnode ends up getting recorded

18.speaker: Player
18.text: And it looks like you've been showering in gore. How'd that happen, huh?

87.speaker: Player
87.text: She was brutalised, the killer knifed her many times after she was dead. Was it you?

13.text: I think I must have killed her.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: Doesn't exactly take the Fist's best detectives to see that - you're covered in her insides. But why?

135.speaker: Player
135.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Wanting to convince herself.

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: I suddenly woke up in the night, and everything was just like this.
73.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Wanting to convince herself.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I have had unusual symptoms from my parasite - perhaps this is a side effect of yours?
12.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Wanting to convince herself.

160.speaker: Narrator
160.text: *The worm in your head has never slept more peacefully. You know in your heart it was something deeper, hungrier.*
160.context: NodeContext: Karlach: With import. This is important.

21.text: Yeah, it must be the parasite.
21.context: NodeContext: Karlach: With import. This is important.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Even if the parasite caused your little 'episode', it had better not happen again. People can't just be murdered in camp - some of us are important.
38.context: NodeContext: Karlach: With import. This is important.

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *An uneasy feeling lingers in the air.*

82.speaker: Narrator
82.text: *As the inquisition departs, you are left alone with a familiar headache.*
82.context: NodeContext: wry chuckle mocking the Dark Urge

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: Mourn: you truly wished to journey beside Alfira.
83.context: NodeContext: wry chuckle mocking the Dark Urge

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *One more failed adventurer, gone to the mud now.*

14.speaker: Narrator
14.text: Vow: you will gain control, you will save the next innocent.
14.context: NodeContext: wry chuckle mocking the Dark Urge

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *Every one of your instincts screams against the saccharine thought. You feel close to fainting again...*

85.speaker: Narrator
85.text: Breathe deeply: you must uncover the cause of your mad spree lest it happen again.
85.context: NodeContext: wry chuckle mocking the Dark Urge

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *Much is uncertain, but you know one thing for sure: the darkness will strike again, unless you find a light.*

116.speaker: Narrator
116.text: Giggle: the only joy greater than murder is to get away with it!
116.context: NodeContext: wry chuckle mocking the Dark Urge

157.speaker: Narrator
157.context: NodeContext: wry chuckle mocking the Dark Urge

113.text: Grind your jaw: that was close - you will hide your crime more carefully next time.

122.speaker: Narrator
122.text: *Something revolts in your churning blood. Why hide what you are? You long to expose yourself.*

26.text: I... don't know. It could have been the tadpole.

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: My body acted outside of my control - it was spasming.

126.speaker: Narrator
126.text: I... I can't remember. I don't know why I did it.

24.text: She attacked me while I was sleeping - I had to!

106.text: I suppose I'll set up a few more magical wards around the camp - this dagger-on-sight praxis isn't the most secure of strategies...

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Huh, I never knew she had it in her. But if it was self-defence, I suppose we can look past the mess.

99.speaker: Narrator
99.text: *It appears the lie that passed through your teeth has lifted some fears.*

47.text: I see no weapon by her body. What possible threat could she have posed?
47.context: NodeContext: Karlach: with her teeth set.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: Nonsense. The girl was timid as a mouse, and hardly more dangerous.
166.context: NodeContext: Karlach: with her teeth set.

61.context: NodeContext: [Astarion: thinking of his own late-night hunts]

57.text: I don't know what happened. I woke up and she was dead.
57.context: NodeContext: [Astarion: thinking of his own late-night hunts]

101.text: A wild boar ran rampant in the camp and gored her.
101.context: NodeContext: [Astarion: thinking of his own late-night hunts]

130.text: So this wild boar stabbed her around fifty-seven times, I suppose?

35.text: So this wild boar stabbed her around fifty-seven times, I suppose?

3.speaker: Player
3.text: A boar stabbed her dozens of times? With a knife, no less?

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Please, you're covered in gore. I know you did it - I just want to know why.

102.text: Must have been a feral animal. She was long dead when I got here.
102.context: NodeContext: [Astarion: thinking of his own late-night hunts]

90.text: She can't have been dead long - we should be watchful.
90.context: NodeContext: [Astarion: thinking of his own late-night hunts]

72.speaker: Player
72.text: We should do better than this. Be better than this, for those who seek our aid.
72.context: NodeContext: [Astarion: thinking of his own late-night hunts]

0.text: Astarion must have been feasting on her - I was trying to patch her wounds.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion indicates the dead and bloody body.

55.text: You can't be serious. I had nothing to do with this!
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion indicates the dead and bloody body.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: You can't be serious. I had nothing to do with this!
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion indicates the dead and bloody body.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: I'd never be this wasteful, for a start. Her blood's everywhere.
127.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion indicates the dead and bloody body.

81.text: Need I remind everyone that you're the one drenched in gore?

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Need I remind everyone that you're the one drenched in gore?

104.speaker: Player
104.text: I don't think it's a bad look, but it is a very guilty one.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Pointing fingers won't save you. It's clear what happened here.

54.text: Astarion is twitching with anticipation looking at this body - he must have killed her.

77.text: Oh no, you're not pinning this on me. You're the one who found her!

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Oh no, you're not pinning this on me. You're the one who found her!

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I hate to accuse one of our own. And yet... it makes sense.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: I get all the blame for a gory murder, but I still have to go hungry? Ridiculous. Absolutely ridiculous.
131.context: NodeContext: So done with this shit

115.speaker: Player
115.text: This is ridiculous. I get all the blame for a gory murder, but none of the satisfaction of actually killing someone.
115.context: NodeContext: So done with this shit

7.text: Astarion has his many faults, but he's certainly not wasteful. If this was his kill, he'd have cleaned up the mess.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: I've seen spined devils tear apart cattle with more care. This doesn't look like a vampire's work...

148.speaker: Player
148.text: I've been on my best behaviour. You all know it.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Another waif dead before her time. I wonder how it happened.
95.context: NodeContext: [Astarion:waking up with the rest of the party to find a dead body in camp, Less sad, more worried that someone could get so close while everyone slept.]

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Did you see something happen? You called for us.

159.text: I... I can't remember. I don't know why I did it.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: What's going on? If something's wrong with you, say it now. This could be your last chance.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: That's... unsettling. It could be one of your parasite's games, maybe?

66.speaker: Player
66.text: So where does this leave us? It's hard to trust someone who blacks out and stabs you to death.

65.text: If you want to leave me, I will understand.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: I could, but we have the same parasites - maybe it'll happen to me next. At least together, we can keep an eye on each other.

146.text: It won't happen again, I promise.

117.text: She did come into the camp unannounced. Perhaps I did the right thing, even with the amnesia.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Stabbing someone a dozen times can be many things, but 'the right thing' to do? I doubt it.

152.text: I can't explain it. I am starting to scare myself.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Is it the tadpole? Has it taken control of you?

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I see... That does sound pretty reasonable, actually.

10.text: The tadpole is doing this to me, I'm sure.

59.text: She was weak - the world would have killed her sooner or later.

170.speaker: Player
170.text: She was an artist. A bard. And even if she was nothing at all, she deserved to live.

1.text: Now my moment of wrath is over, I do regret it.

140.text: A wild boar ran rampant in the camp and gored her.

51.text: And this wild boar stabbed more times than I can even count? Please, give me some credit.

144.text: And this wild boar stabbed more times than I can even count? Please, give me some credit.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Those are knife wounds, and you know it. A terrifying number of them.

161.speaker: Player
161.text: Another waif dead before her time. I wonder how it happened.

128.text: I... I can't remember. I don't know why I did it.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: You don't remember? Why? What's wrong with you?

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I'm just not sure where this leaves us? It's hard to trust someone who blacks out and stabs you to death.

37.text: It won't happen again, I promise.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: It had better not. I don't know if this was the parasite's fault or yours, darling, but I'll keep an extra close eye on you both.

49.text: I can't explain it. I am starting to scare myself.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Is it the tadpole? Has it taken control of you?

52.text: I don't know what happened. I woke up and she was dead.

129.text: A wild boar ran rampant in the camp and gored her.

60.text: And this wild boar stabbed her until she resembled a sieve, did it?

25.text: And this wild boar stabbed her until she resembled a sieve, did it?

150.speaker: Player
150.text: Those are knife wounds, and you know it. A terrifying number of them.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Listen, darling -  you're covered in gore. I know you killed her, I just want to know why.

133.text: Must have been a feral animal. She was long dead when I got here.

44.text: The body hasn't even cooled yet. We need to stay alert.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: How did I sleep through that? Gods, poor Alfira. She must've been terrified.
